DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of the chromosonal location of the PTEN gene, which plays a role in signal transduction and apoptosis, and is involved in the regulation of cell cycle progression.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: This gene plays a role in signal transduction and apoptosis. It is also involved in the regulation of cell cycle progression._Any change in the DNA of a cell.  Mutations may be caused by mistakes during cell division, or they may be caused by exposure to DNA-damaging agents in the environment.  Mutations can be harmful, beneficial, or have no effect.  If they occur in cells that make eggs or sperm, they can be inherited; if mutations occur in other types of cells, they are not inherited.  Certain mutations may lead to cancer or other diseases.__A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: This gene plays a role in signal transduction and apoptosis. It is also involved in the regulation of cell cycle progression.:Genetic alterations found in the neoplastic lesions of the animal model. These alterations are not made intentionally.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a role in signal transduction and apoptosis. It is also involved in the regulation of cell cycle progression.
Genetic alterations found in the neoplastic lesions of the animal model. These alterations are not made intentionally.

Property.preferredDefinition: A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information. :A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule)._Any change in the DNA of a cell.  Mutations may be caused by mistakes during cell division, or they may be caused by exposure to DNA-damaging agents in the environment.  Mutations can be harmful, beneficial, or have no effect.  If they occur in cells that make eggs or sperm, they can be inherited; if mutations occur in other types of cells, they are not inherited.  Certain mutations may lead to cancer or other diseases._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found._Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position on a particular chromosome and serves as the template for a product that contributes to a phenotype or a biological function.
Genetic alterations found in the neoplastic lesions of the animal model. These alterations are not made intentionally.
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for NCI CCR Protocol in C3D.
